titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the LAC0018 The James Neff Labor Archives - the IBT Collection, 1953-1989 LAC0018
titlestmt.author: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

repository.corpname: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

did.unittitle: LAC0018 The James Neff Labor Archives - the IBT Collection

physdesc.extent: 42 record center cartons containing 1,428 microfilm reels, paper files, 142 VHS tapes, and photographs.

did.physloc: Materials are stored off-site, and will require additional retrieval time. Please contact the Special Collections Research Center for more information.
did.abstract: This collection consists of 14 series. Series 1 contains microfilm reels of a range of documentation created by various departments and offices of the International Brotherhood of Teamsters. The microfilm reels were selected for copying by James Neff in the 1990s. Series 2 contains files having to do with IBT history. Series 3 contains files having to do with IBT locals. Series 4 contains miscellaneous newspapers produced by IBT. Series 5 contains biographies and news clippings pertaining to certain key members of IBT. Series 6 contains articles, pamphlets, and flyers published by IBT. Series 7 contains files having to do with the Eastern Conference of Teamsters. Series 8 contains correspondence between IBT President Dan Tobin and US President Franklin Delano Roosevelt. Series 9 contains files having to do with various large companies associated with IBT. Series 10 contains newspaper clippings about IBT. Series 11 contains publications by organizations outside of IBT. Series 12 contains constitution booklets and convention materials from IBT and IBT affiliated groups. Series 13 contains VHS and U-Matic tapes of movies produced by IBT or related to IBT. Series 14 contains miscellaneous photographs from IBT.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Some material may be copyrighted or restricted. It is the patron's obligation to determine and satisfy copyright or other case restrictions when publishing or otherwise distributing materials found in the collections.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Please cite unpublished materials in the following way:
Please provide the title and date of item, catalog number (if applicable it will be found written on the folder), name of the collection, name of the repository, and location of the repository.

Example: James Oglethorpe to the Trustees, 13 January 1876, RG0001 Series 1, Box 4, Folder 3. Records of the Board of Trustees, Special Collections Research Center, Gelman Library, The George Washington University, Washington, D.C.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The microfilm collection is organized by IBT department or topics covered in the microfilmed documentation. Series 2 through 12 are organized chronologically and by subject. Series 13 is arranged in no particular order. Series 14 is arranged by photograph type.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains material pertaining to the International Brotherood of Teamsters amassed by board member and president of Investigative Reporters and Editors James Neff. Materials include microfilm reels, paper files, VHS and U-Matic tapes, photographs and transparency film slides dating from 1953-1989

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: James Neff, born 1953, is a US Nonfiction author and an investigative journalist. Neff is an alumnus of the University of Notre Dame and holds a Master's Degree in American Civilization from the University of Texas Austin. He has worked as a reporter, columnist, editor, and investigator for a number of publications including the Austin-American Statesman, The Plain Dealer, The Seattle Times, The Philadelphia Inquirer, Philadelphia Daily News, and Philly.com. From 1994 to 1999, Neff was the Willard M. Kiplinger Chair in Public Affairs Reporting in Ohio State University School of Journalism and Communication. He was a board member and president of Investigative Reporters and Editors, Inc. from 1991 to 2002.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The Administrative files series is arranged numerically by reel number.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains documents that were originally housed in the IBT central files room and cover a range of topics.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The Legal Department series is arranged numerically by reel number.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Legal Department series contains documents relating to IBT's legal concerns such as court cases.

did.unittitle: Legal Department, Government Affairs, McClellan Hearings, and NLRB Files

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Government Affairs series, the McClellan Committee Hearings sries and tghe NLRB files series contain a range of documents related to these topics.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: These reels are arrannged numerically by reel number.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The Newsclips series and Monitorships series are arranged numercially by reel number.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The Newsclips series and the Monitorship series contain documents relating to those topics.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The General Secretary Treasurer's Office series is arranged numerically by reel number.

did.unittitle: General Secretary- Treasurer and Economics Department

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The General Secretary-Treasurer series and the Economics Department series contains documents created by the GS-T's office and the Economics Department.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The reels of these two series are arranged numerically by reel number.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The Affiliated Bodies series and General Files series are arranged numerically by reel number.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Affiliated Bodies series and the General Files series contain documents relating to IBT locals and documents of general IBT interest.

did.unittitle: Area Conferences, Staff Series, Personnel, and General Files

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The Area Conferences series, Staff series, Personnel and General series are arranged numerically by reel number.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Area Conferences series, the Staff series and the Personnel series contain documents relating to the operations of the Teamsters Area conferences and to matters relatiing to IBT staff.

did.unittitle: Local Unions, Agreements, Communications Department, and Safety and Health Department

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The Local Unions series, Agreements series, Communicastions Department series and Safety and Health Departmenrt series are arranged numerically by reel number.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These series contain correspondenece with IBT local unions, copies of agreements between locals and companies represented, and Communicationa Department and Safety and Health Department publications and correspondence.

did.unittitle: State Historical Society, Wisconsin Collection, UPS, Alliance for Union Action, and JBT HQ

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The State Historical Society of Wisconsin series, the UPS series, the Alliance for Labor Action series and the IBT HQ series are arranged numerically by reel number.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The reels in the State Historical Society of Wisconsin series contain documents from the colelction, Records of ther IBT 1907-1952, transferred to the SHSW in the late 1960s. The UPS reels relate to UPS contracts and worker representation. The ALA reels relate to short-lived Alliance for Labor Action, an IBT and UAW joint organizing effort. The IBT HQ reels contain documents relating to the day-today operations of the Teamsters Union.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The Miscellaneous Topics series is arranged by topic then numerically by reel number.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains miscellaneous microfilm rolls.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains files having to do with International Brotherhood of Teamsters history. The files include manuscripts on Teamster history, local Teamster union history, and scanned files from the early years of the union.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged by subject.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains publications by organizations that are not the International Brotherhood of Teamsters. Some publications are specifically related to the Teamsters. Some publications do not make specific reference to the Teamsters, but rather are relevant to the wider labor movement.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains constitutions and convention materials from the International Brotherhood of Teamsters and some of its affiliates, including the International Union of United Brewery, Flour, Cereal, Soft Drink and Distillery Workers. Most constitutions and convention materials are paperback booklets.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains various VHS tapes and U-Matic tapes that pertain to the International Brotherhood of Teamsters. Most tapes are directly produced by IBT. Finding aid descriptions are exactly as they are labeled on the tapes. The VHS tapes have been tested for quality and should be in working condition.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: VHS tapes in this series are arranged at random.

physdesc.extent: Boxes 38-44, 5 record center boxes and 2 flat boxes

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains various photographs from the International Brotherhood of Teamsters. Some photographs are labeled and have descriptions. Most photos are estimated to be from 1950-1989, with the majority being from the 1950's and 1960's. Photograph types include: contact sheets, mounted photographs, loose photographs, and transparency film slides.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged by photograph format.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This box contains unlabeled contact sheets of photographs and mounted photographs. Some mounted photographs are labeled. Estimated dates for the photographs are 1950-1989, with most photographs being from 1950-1970.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This box contains Teamster mounted photographs, loose photographs, and negatives. Some photographs have descriptions. The estimated photograph dates are 1950-1989, with most photographs being from 1950-1970.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This box contains transparency film slides having to do with the Teamsters. Slides include photographs and presentation slides. Estimated dates for the slides are 1950-1969.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This box contains transparency film slides having to do with the Teamsters. Slides include photographs and presentation slides. Estimated dates for the slides are 1950-1969.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This box contains transparency film slides having to do with the Teamsters. Slides include photographs and presentation slides. Estimated dates for the slides are 1950-1969.
